mdRecord.dcterms:title: Cosmographia
Claudii Ptolemaei cosmographiae
Ptolemy, active 2nd century. Geographia. Latin. 1475
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: D'Angelo, Jacopo
Lichtenstein, Hermann, -1494
McGregor Fund.
Michaele, Angelo
Picardus, Barnabas
Ptolemy, active 2nd century
Stevens, Henry Jr, 1819-1886
Tracy W. McGregor Library. American History Collection.
Trivisano, Benedicto
Vadius, Angelus
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: En tibi lector cosmographia Ptolemaei ab Hermano leuilapide [i.e., Hermannus Liechtenstein] coloniensi Vicenciae accuratissime impressa. Benedicto Triuisano: & Angelo Michaele praesidibus
mdRecord.dcterms:description: First edition, which was published without maps.
Dedication: Beatissimo Patri Alexandro Quinto Pont. Max. Angelus, begins on 2a3 recto and ends on the verso.
Imprint from colophon on leaf G10 verso.
Signatures: 2a¹⁰(-2a1) 2b⁸(-2b8) a¹⁰ b-g⁸ h¹⁰ A-F⁸ G¹⁰ (1st leaf of each gathering and d2 unsigned; 2a1 blank?)
Capital spaces without guide letters; initials; printed in roman type; text 39 lines in a full page; without catchwords and foliation.
Diagrams on: 2b5 verso, 2b6 verso, 2b7 verso and F3 recto.
Translated by Jacopo D'Angelo and edited by Angelus Vadius and Barnabas Picardus.

SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Bound in full red crushed levant morocco; gilt tooled edges on covers, ornate gilt tooled inside borders and marbled endpapers. Housed in a full red morocco pull-off case by Hyman Zucker. Library copy lacks the first blank leaf 2a1, and 2b8. From the library of Henry Stevens of Vermont, with "Tree of knowledge" bookplate which has the poem written by Henry Stevens Senior, of Vermont. Bookplate dated 1882. Tracy W. McGregor Library, American History Collection. This copy recataloged and digitized through a generous grant from the McGregor Fund.
